name: contexts
title: Contexts
description: Contexts lets you manage and access large text repositories for AI interactions. Create, edit, and organize contextual information about companies, products, or documentation that can be referenced during AI conversations. Seamlessly handle extensive context without cluttering system instructions, allowing for more efficient and focused AI interactions.
author: marcmagn1

commands.name: create-new-context
commands.title: Create New Context
commands.description: Create a new text-based context that can be referenced in AI conversations. Add documentation, company information, or any relevant content that helps frame future AI interactions.

commands.name: append-to-context
commands.title: Append to Context
commands.description: Add new text content to an existing context file. Append information while preserving all previously stored content.

tools.name: list-contexts
tools.title: List Contexts
tools.description: List all available context files that can be accessed.

tools.name: get-context
tools.title: Get Context
tools.description: Retrieve the content of a saved context file. Pass the context name to read its content.

tools.name: append-to-context
tools.title: Append to Context
tools.description: Append new content to an existing context file.

tools.name: create-context
tools.title: Create Context
tools.description: Create a new context file with optional initial content.

tools.name: rename-context
tools.title: Rename Context
tools.description: Rename an existing context file to a new name.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1

ai.instructions: When a user asks for a specific context, always list available contexts first to find the closest match. Only attempt to get-context, append-to-context, delete-context, or rename-context after confirming the exact name from the list-contexts result. When creating a new context, check if a similar name already exists.
